inscription:
Inscriptions; Seals

Translation of inscription (A. Rio, 2/24/2016)

Portrait of Master Dongpo in Wide-Brimmed Hat and Sandals

My mind is like a log turned to ashes, my body like an unanchored boat.
Were someone to ask what my life\'s work is, [I would say] Huangzhou, Tanzhou, and Huizhou. When the master journeyed to the Red Cliff, he composed an incomparable prose-poem. The cool breeze and bright moon are the same now as then, in autumn, the seventh month of 1082. What does the disciple love about these thousand autumns? Memories of 1082 are numerous. If the spirit wandering the Red Cliff is responsive, from the tip of my brush will emerge hundreds of Su Dongpo\'s. 

Fourteen [sexagenary] cycles have passed since Su journeyed to the Red Cliff. Many generations later, I am thrilled by this unexpected occasion, on this the 27th day of the fifth month of 1922...
markings: block of untranslated text, in black, at top; 6 seals, in red, 5 in text block, one at LR corner
title: Master Dongpo Wearing a Wide-brimmed Hat and Sandals
